io.soliton.protobuf

Interface ClientLogger

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NullClientLogger

    public interface ClientLogger
    Hook interface to allow plugging-in an arbitrary white-box monitoring framework in Piezo.
    Author:
    Julien Silland (julien@soliton.io)

    • Method Detail

      • logMethodCall

        void logMethodCall(ClientMethod<?> method)
        Invoked upon a client-side method being called.
        Parameters:
        method - the method being invoked

      • logClientError

        void logClientError(ClientMethod<?> method,
                  Throwable cause)
        Invoked upon an error happening on the client-side, e.g. failed method call because of a broken link.
        Parameters:
        method - the method that was called when the error happened
        cause - the underlying cause of the error

      • logServerError

        void logServerError(String serviceName,
                  String methodName,
                  Throwable cause)
        Invoked when an error was returned from the server.
        Parameters:
        serviceName -
        methodName -
        cause - the underlying cause of the error, as returned by the server

      • logLinkError

        <O extends Message> void logLinkError(ClientMethod<O> method,
                                    Throwable cause)
        Invoked upon an error occurring while sending a method call to the server.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the response type of the method
        Parameters:
        method - the method that was invoked
        cause - the cause of the error

      • logClientSuccess

        <O extends Message> void logClientSuccess(ClientMethod<O> clientMethod)
        Invoked when a method invocation returned a successful response.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the return type of the method
        Parameters:
        clientMethod - the method that was invoked
